front: Match the following networking terms related to data transmission with their descriptions:
back:
Segmentation → Dividing a stream of data into smaller units for transmission over a network.
Multiplexing → Interleaving multiple conversations on a network by segmenting large data streams.
Sequencing → Numbering message segments to ensure correct reassembly at the destination.
Encapsulation → Adding protocol information to data as it moves down the protocol stack.

pairs.right: Dividing a stream of data into smaller units for transmission over a network.
Interleaving multiple conversations on a network by segmenting large data streams.
Numbering message segments to ensure correct reassembly at the destination.
Adding protocol information to data as it moves down the protocol stack.

front: Match the following Protocol Data Units (PDUs) with their corresponding OSI layers:
back:
Data → The general term for the PDU used at the application layer.
Segment → The protocol data unit (PDU) used at the transport layer.
Packet → The protocol data unit (PDU) used at the network layer.
Frame → The protocol data unit (PDU) used at the data link layer.

pairs.right: The general term for the PDU used at the application layer.
The protocol data unit (PDU) used at the transport layer.
The protocol data unit (PDU) used at the network layer.
The protocol data unit (PDU) used at the data link layer.
